column4: illumin i think the problem is the rest of partitions are extended partitions that were mounted under some folders, storage also i assume
well is there a way i could mount these partitions ?
what are you trying to mount
looks like a bunch of linux partitions
mount -t ext3 /dev/hda3 /wherever why not this command?
have you formated the partitions yet? do they have a filesystem on them?
msg me the mount output and df -h output
what will raid 1 do for you
id have to dig into raid, but it sounds like those partitions arent doing you much good
I am not raid guru tho, but i have a feeling if you formated using mkfs.ext3 you would be able to mount them
did you try mount force option?
are you sure these are ext3 filesystems?
what are you trying to achieve? i mean, your running linux, and it looks like you have some of your partitions mounted, so the other ones are just sitting there, what are you afraid of losing ?
there is a database full of documents somewhere on this drive
but not on any of the partitions currently mounted?
do you know how to priv msg?
send me your fdisk results, along with df -h along with mount
